description.narrative: Project aims at addressing remaining barriers to an effective and efficient Protected Area system.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. Area of existing protected areas under improved management (i.e. the total area of 12 KBAs targeted by the project) is 431,872 ha 2. Number of direct project beneficiaries is at least 500 3. PA system financing as measured by the Financial Sustainability Scorecard is increased to at least 55% 4. Long-term annual funding to target 12 PAs is Increased to US$950,000 5. Number of target PAs regularly receiving full financing support is 12 6. revenues generated from tourism activities in target PAs is US$200,000 7. Average level of institutional capacities for financial-administrative planning and operational management planning as measured by Capacity Assessment Scorecard (CAS) values for target PAs is 50%, including: Systemic 50%, Institutional 42%, Individual 44% 8. Level of management effectiveness measured by METT score values for the 12 target PAs have increased by on average 10 points over the baseline 9. Non-deterioration of populations of key species mentioned in the individual METT scorecards 10. At least 10,000 people have been given opportunity to take notice of, or participate in, a variety of targeted awareness raising activities and materials on biodiversity values and benefits from Target PAs

comment.narrative: 1. Area of target PA's where natural resources are managed under a sustainable use, conservation, access and benefit-sharing regime is 0 ha(hectares) 2. PA system financing as measured by the Financial Sustainability Scorecard is 43% 3. Annual funding to target 12 PAs is US$650,000 4. Number of target PAs regularly receiving full financing support is 6 5. revenues generated from tourism activities in target PAs is US$102,500 6. Average level of institutional capacities for financial-administrative planning and operational management planning as measured by Capacity Assessment Scorecard (CAS) values for target PAs is 30%, including: Systemic 33%, Institutional 31%, Individual 21% 7. Level of management effectiveness of target PAs measured by METT score values is: BKNP - 48; LPA – 48; VPA – 56; TPA/TPL – 56/41; MNP – 48; JNP – 47; KNP – 33; ANP – 43; KPA – 45; PsKPA – 24; MachNP – 47 8. Community, stakeholder and societal knowledge of and support for target PAs is limited, their importance and benefits are poorly communicated in society

1. Analysis of current financing and financing needs for basic and optimal management for 6 target PAs (contributes to indicator 1,3,4,5) 2. Opportunity Analysis of revenue generating instruments, identification of priorities PAs (contributes to indicator 1,3,4,5) 3. Sustainable tourism development pre-investment feasibility studies and costed investment/business plan for at least 2 target PAs (contributes to indicator 6) 4. Update Management Plans and/or related 3-year Operational Plans for at least 2 target PA (contributes to indicator 1,2,7,8,9) 5. Complete a comprehensive review of existing capacities, past initiatives, outstanding capacity needs, and training materials available at the system and target PA level; prepare a Capacity Building Action Plan (contributes to indicator 1,2,7,8) 6. Develop at least 2 standardized target PA-specific Management Effectiveness Assessment plans (contributes to indicator 1,7,8,9) 7. Introduction of new technology for patrolling in at least 2 target PAs (contributes to indicator 1,2,7,8,9) 8. Conduct technical monitoring in at least 3 target PAs (contributes to indicator 1,7,8)

1. Analysis of current financing and financing needs for basic and optimal management for 8 target PAs prepared. Financing GAPs identified. GAP identification scorecard prepared and approved by APA for future use. 2. Opportunity Analysis of revenue generating instruments conducted. Income generation alternatives identified for detailed survey. 3. Business plans for sustainable tourism development project prepared for Borjomi-Kharagauli NP and Javakheti PAs and forwarded to APA. 4. Management Plans and related 3-year Operational Plans for Borjomi-Kharagauli NP and Javakheti PAs prepared and approved by APA. 5. Georgia Protected Areas System Capacity needs analysis and capacity building action plan prepared. 6. PA-specific Management Effectiveness Assessment plans for Machakhela and Mtirala PAs prepared. 7. The hardware for introduction of SMART patrolling system procured for 5 PAs. Training plan prepared. 8. Technical and Financial Audits of 3 PAs conducted, reports produced and shared with APA.

1. Preparation of detailed feasibility studies for pilot implementation of identified revenue generating instruments (contributes to indicator 1,3,4,5) 2.Detailed evaluation and project design for sustainable tourism products identified in business plan developed for the Borjomi Kharagauli NP (contributes to indicator 6). 3. Finalization of the design and implementation of the tourism project in Nedzvi Managed Reserve of the BKNP (contributes to indicator 6). 4. Revision/Update of Management Plan for 2 target PAs (contributes to indicator 1,2,7,8,9) 5. Strengthen systemic, institutional and individual capacities at system level (APA) through implementation of the specific actions form the Protected Areas Capacity Building Action Plan (contributes to indicator 1,2,7,8) 6.Identification and selection of key protected area value indicators (species and habitat) for inclusion in PA-specific Management Effectiveness Assessment plans (contributes to indicator 1,7,8,9). 7. Field-based assessments of selected indicators (flora, fauna, habitat) using innovative techniques (contributes to indicator 1,7,8,9). 8. Introduction of new technology for patrolling in the target Protected areas (contributes to indicator 1,2,7,8,9) 9. Conduct technical and financial monitoring program of at least 3 4 target PAs (contributes to indicator 1,7,8)

1. Detailed feasibility studies for revenue Generation instruments in Tusheti Protected Landscape (TPL) prepared, including Phase 1 of Tourism Levy introduction in TPL and Standard for arrangement and leasing our of camping sites, with detailed designs 2.Detailed technical project for Qvabiskhevi tourism complex in BKNP prepared and submitted to APA 3. Nedzvi touristic trail fully developed with signage, markings, overnight stay and relevant visitor infrastructure, including cottage, picnic area etc. 4.Drafts final Management plans and associated 3-year operational plans of Tusheti and Vashlovani PAs prepared and submitted to APA for approval. 5. Implemented capacity building activities include: support for APA’s financial department, secondment to Biodiversity and Forestry Department of the MEPA, SMART training, initiation of planning of Video training on law enforcement. 6. Selection of biodiversity state/value indicators for 12 target PAs through a participatory process completed (long list, short list, 10 year monitoring plan and monitoring protocols) 7. Field survey of identified biodiversity indicators initiated, including: Red deer in Lagodekhi and Tusheti PAs, Bezoar Goat in Tuhseti and Khevsureti PAs, Ungulates in 3 Achara PAs. The baselines for these species established. 8. Radio stations and transceivers for improving of patrolling of Abastumani section of the BKNP provided. 9. Technical and financial audits for 6 Pas Borjomi-Kharagauli, Javakheti, Lagodekhi, Vashlovani, Mtirala and Machakhela PAs prepared and shared with the Agency of Protected areas.

1.Pilot implementation of identified revenue generating instruments (contributes to indicator 1,3,4,5) 2. Revision/Update of Management Plan for 2 target PAs (contributes to indicator 1,2,7,8,9) 3. Strengthen systemic, institutional and individual capacities at system level (APA) through development of PA system wide online learning platform and implementation of the specific actions form the Protected Areas Capacity Building Action Plan (contributes to indicator 1,2,7,8) 4. Introduction and enhancement of SMART patrolling technique in target PAs 5. Field-based assessments of selected indicators (flora, fauna, habitat) using innovative techniques (contributes to indicator 1,7,8,9). 6. Conduct technical monitoring in at least 3 target PAs (contributes to indicator 1,7,8)

1. The pilot revenue Generation instrument in Tusheti Protected Landscape completed including preparation of detailed designs of camping sites and implementation of one of the camping site construction works for concession. 2.Drafts final Management plans and associated 3-year operational plans of Mtirala and Lagodekhi PAs prepared and submitted to APA for approval. 3. The PA system online training platform developed, incorporating 10 online courses. Financial policy procedures (accounting and reporting) document developed for the Agency of Protected Areas. 4. SMAT patrolling equipment provided and SMART officers trained in all target PAs. Rangers trained in SMART application of patrolling technique in 8 target PAs. 5. Field survey of identified biodiversity indicators implemented in selected PAs initiated, including: bezoar goats and East Caucasian tur in Pshav-Khevsureti NP and Tusheti PAs; Red Deer in Borjomi NP and Lagodekhi NP; Ungulates in 3 Ajara PAs, Birds in Vashlovani, Kazbegi, Borjomi; Trout in Mtirala, Kintrishi and Borjomi-Kharagauli, Forest ecological assessment and Chestnut diseases n Mtirala and Kintrishi, Forest pathology survey in Borjomi-Kharagauli. 6. Technical and financial monitoring in Vashlovani, Algeti, Pshav-Khevsureti, Kazbegi and Kintrishi conducted; reports produced and shared with APA.
